conflictDescription: User Story A expects caregivers to join virtual exercise sessions with clients, while User Story B requires all developer meetings to be held online without exceptions, which may forbid or restrict in-person or mixed meeting formats. This creates opposite instructions about how meetings or sessions should be conducted.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to join exercise sessions with my clients to support them and strengthen our connection.
userStoryBSummary: As a developer, I want to hold all meetings online without exceptions, so I can explain updates and keep control.
